body: the version is 4.0.0.R2
what is your `server.yaml` configuration?

> How slow is it? Can you provide more information?

1 second slower than version 3.1.0, tested with native jdbc, and I don't kown why . I monitor it with skywalking then I found the problem is in the parseSQL phase, but I didn't go to see the source code. Hope you can help me.

> what is your `server.yaml` configuration?

```yml
authentication:
  users:
    root:
      password: root
    sharding:
      password: sharding 
      authorizedSchemas: sharding_db
```

so props content is empty? like this
```
props:
  max.connections.size.per.query: 1
  acceptor.size: 16  # The default value is available processors count * 2.
  executor.size: 16  # Infinite by default.
  proxy.frontend.flush.threshold: 128  # The default value is 128.
    # LOCAL: Proxy will run with LOCAL transaction.
    # XA: Proxy will run with XA transaction.
    # BASE: Proxy will run with B.A.S.E transaction.
  proxy.transaction.type: LOCAL
  proxy.opentracing.enabled: false
  query.with.cipher.column: true
  sql.show: false
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14866067/64010851-2084b880-cb4d-11e9-8769-2433b97b00eb.png)
Success too. I have no idea. 😂 Maybe you should clean your directory, download [sharding-proxy](http://mirror.bit.edu.cn/apache/incubator/shardingsphere/4.0.0-RC2/apache-shardingsphere-incubating-4.0.0-RC2-sharding-proxy-bin.tar.gz ), config and run it again.

> @liuyangming thanks for your contribution.
> when I see your example [RequiresNewOrderServiceImpl.java](https://github.com/liuyangming/shardingjdbc-sample/blob/issue-2902/src/main/java/com/bytesvc/shardingjdbc/sample/service/impl/RequiresNewOrderServiceImpl.java), I want to clarify our current transaction scope.
> 
> 1.support distribute transaction in one ShardingConnection.
> 2.support distribute transaction using local transaction api.
> 3.not support distribute transaction in multiple sharding connections.
> 4.not support distribute transaction in JTA way.
> 
> it seems that you're trying to do some work on `4.` point, in my opinion, the example code can be only supported by JTA, but this is not what we want to integrate currently.

This is a standard usage scenario, regardless of whether or not JTA is used. There is unnecessary to require the business system to abandon the spring declarative transaction. Although such a constraint can be made, in general it is not reasonable. sharding-jdbc should consider this requirement as much as possible.
I suggest you verify the feature using proxy command line at first

Yes I did clean the sharding-proxy root directory and then re-uncompress the binary package and config, this is the steps. You'r success so the configure in my side is ok ? 
By the way, what's the zookeeper version you used ?
My zk's version is 3.4.14. But i don't think it's related to zk, cause this exception be thrown at the time of parse configuration.
Ok, i will try to deploy again. Thx.
Can you explain the reason to close this issue?
Can you explain the reason to close this issue?
duplicate with #2933

```yml
spring:
  shardingsphere:
    props:
      sql.show: true
      query.with.cipher.comlum: true
    datasource:
      name: ds0
      ds0:
        type: org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource
        driver-class-name: com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver
        url: jdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/test?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf-8&serverTimezone=UTC
        username: root
        password: root
        max-total: 100
    sharding:
      tables:
        user:
          actual-data-nodes: ds0.user_$->{0..4}
          table-strategy:
            inline:
              sharding-column: id
              algorithm-expression: user_$->{id % 5}
      encrypt-rule:
        encryptors:
          encryptor_aes:
            type: aes
            props.aes.key.value: 123456
        tables:
          user:
            columns:
              name:
                cipherColumn: name
                encryptor: encryptor_aes
```
Try again with this. `encrypt-rule` must be `sharding`'s child node.
Can you clone [dev](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/tree/dev) branch and try to run it?
Duplicate of https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/issues/2924.

>                 encryptor: encryptor_aes

> Try again with this. `encrypt-rule` must be `sharding`'s child node.

why load not sharding table ? 
@terrymanu
Just pending because sharding-jdbc's merge engine cannot support.
Can you explain how to do SQL injection?

This part is still in refactoring. 
So I would like to close this and label as duplicate with #2567

Because of ShardingSphere 4.x changed the SQL parse engine to support more SQL, but performance of parser is slow than before. After first time to parse, SQL AST will be cached.
I don't think this is a bug, it is necessary balance of design and performance.
By the way, even use old parse engine, the performance is faster than new parse engine, but still can not reach the benchmark of internet OLTP systems.
Can you show some configuration?

You must use `HintManager` If you wanna use `HintShardingAlgorithm`. [Hint-example](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-example/tree/dev/sharding-jdbc-example/other-feature-example/hint-example) is an example for hint, maybe you should look at it first.

from my side the example is not the standard local transaction usage, you can try to modify the example to use local transaction only, the transaction will be not effective.

> and the proxy is downloaded from our official site? [4.0.0-RC2](https://www.apache.org/dyn/closer.cgi?path=incubator/shardingsphere/4.0.0-RC2/apache-shardingsphere-incubating-4.0.0-RC2-sharding-proxy-bin.tar.gz)

Yes , i'm downloaded from http://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/apache/incubator/shardingsphere/4.0.0-RC2/apache-shardingsphere-incubating-4.0.0-RC2-sharding-proxy-bin.tar.gz
and hint strategy should have some problems in proxy, it should be only supported on XA transaction, see #2914
hint is based on thread local, but proxy could not ensure this except within a XA transaction type.

you can try to  config like this:
```
props:
  proxy.transaction.type: XA
```

> You must use `HintManager` If you wanna use `HintShardingAlgorithm`. [Hint-example](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-example/tree/dev/sharding-jdbc-example/other-feature-example/hint-example) is an example for hint, maybe you should look at it first.

Yes，I was read the example, it's for jdbc.
Now I want to use it in mybatis, and I don't konw how to mixin the HintManager into mybatis.

> from my side the example is not the standard local transaction usage, you can try to modify the example to use local transaction only, the transaction will be not effective.

[Shardingjdbc-sample](https://github.com/liuyangming/shardingjdbc-sample/tree/issue-2902) contains both XA transactions and local transactions, because I verified the XA transaction scenario at the end, so the default configuration is an example of an XA transaction instead of a Local transaction. To change to a Local transaction, just adjust @Import(AtomikosConfiguration.class) to @Import(ShardingConfiguration.class) in the ShardingJdbcSampleBootstrap class. The ShardingConfiguration class explicitly defines a DataSourceTransactionManager that manages local transactions.

You don't need to know whether there's relationship between admin and user. If you just answer my question instead of think what I think, things may become easier.

> 
> [Shardingjdbc-sample](https://github.com/liuyangming/shardingjdbc-sample/tree/issue-2902) contains both XA transactions and local transactions, because I verified the XA transaction scenario at the end, so the default configuration is an example of an XA transaction instead of a Local transaction. To change to a Local transaction, just adjust @import(AtomikosConfiguration.class) to @import(ShardingConfiguration.class) in the ShardingJdbcSampleBootstrap class. The ShardingConfiguration class explicitly defines a DataSourceTransactionManager that manages local transactions.

Sorry, you may also need to exclude the sharding-transaction-xa-atomikos-manager dependency from pom.xml.

ShardingRule configuration also have problems, you have some misunderstand about hint it should be like this, please see our hint-example [here](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-example/tree/dev/sharding-jdbc-example/other-feature-example/hint-example)

```
shardingRule:
  tables:
    test_table:
      actualDataNodes: ds${0..1}.test_table${0..1}
  defaultDatabaseStrategy:
    hint:
      algorithmClassName: org.DbHintShardingAlgorithm
  defaultTableStrategy:
    hint:
      algorithmClassName: org.TableHintShardingAlgorithm
```
let me try to modify your code of example later.
you can try to debug it, and see our example, how to use hint, HintMananger is necessary.
sorry, hint cannot be supported, because we have not api to set HintManager through proxy JDBC.

I think I found the reason of this problem. Let me show my analysis.
TableMetaDataLoader.java in dev branch:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4453100/64092420-52815f00-cd87-11e9-9140-092302ace85f.png)

TableMetaDataLoader.java in 4.0.0-RC2-release:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4453100/64092513-b4da5f80-cd87-11e9-95b0-08082e8bfbac.png)

In the dev branch,the masterSlave DataSourceName can not match the original DataSourceName in dataSourceMetaDataMap of DataSourceMetas.java. Some logic of masterSlave was removed in DataSourceMetas. 

If that can not match, catalog will be null. If catalog will be null then the mysql will find the first datasource to search table,in my mysql,the first datasource is admin.

> // call maybtis method.
> orderMapper.selectById(id);
> ```

I'd like to share some details about how to redefine the DataSource.

1. Use SkyWalking [apm-agent-core](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/apm-sniffer/apm-agent-core) instead of byte-buddy to hack JDBC code. apm-agent-core has significantly enhanced byte-buddy.

2. When an original DataSource is hacked for example to a ShardingDataSource. How to decide the behavior when the method of this DataSource is called? 
If the user call ds.getConnection(), we want the DataSource behaves like a ShardingDataSource. While if the Sharding-JDBC call ds.getConnection(), we want the DataSource behaves like an original DataSource.
It's convenient that we can find out who currently call getConnection() via Thread.currentThread().getStackTrace(). When the stack trace is from Sharding-JDBC, we treat the DataSource as the original one. 

3. How to support so many DataSources from various connection pools?
We have to redefine DataSources for some popular connection pools one by one. At first we only need to hack HikariDataSource and add it to a support list. After that users can add others they want.

Hi, @betterjava I am sorry for not giving your reply quickly, after reviewing your pr, it is great, i think. But this issue need to be updated, i think it is also easy for u, so can u try to modify this pr to make this feature better?
**The updated issue is:**
> Instead of hiding the AssistedQueryColumns, we should show the logicColumns to users. i.e, You need to hide all the AssistedQueryColumns and cipherColumns, and show encryptColumns to user.
One encryptDataSource may contain mulitple encryptTables, and one encryptTable may contain multiple encryptColumns, and one encryptColumn may contain AssistedQueryColumn and cipherColumn. You can read EncryptTable.java to learn the relationship of them.
Therefore, we want user to see the names of encryptColumn, not AssistedQueryColumn or cipherColumn.

I test in mysql 5.7.21, offset and row count of limit can be over INTEGER.MAX.
```
sql> select * from t_order limit 0, 9999999999
[2019-09-03 09:21:48] 5 rows retrieved starting from 1 in 28ms (execution: 17ms, fetching: 11ms)
sql> select * from t_order limit 9999999999, 9999999999
[2019-09-03 09:22:27] 0 rows retrieved in 37ms (execution: 21ms, fetching: 16ms)
``` 

So, I think `Pagination` in ShardingSphere should use type Long instead of Integer for offset and row count to solve this exception.
@betterjava  yes, we should hide actual columns, i.e, AssistedQueryColumn and cipherColumn, and show user the virtual column name, i.e, encryptColumn.
